sub_topic: Finding the determinant of a matrix
message_1:
Solve for the determinant of the following 3x3 matrix:

$$\begin{pmatrix}2 & 3 & 4\\ 1 & 0 & 3\\ 2 & 1 & 5\end{pmatrix}$$
message_2:
To find the determinant of a 3x3 matrix, we can use the following formula:

$$\det(A) = a(ei - fh) - b(di - fg) + c(dh - eg)$$

where the matrix A is:

$$\begin{pmatrix}a & b & c\\ d & e & f\\ g & h & i\end{pmatrix}$$

In our case, the matrix is:

$$\begin{pmatrix}2 & 3 & 4\\ 1 & 0 & 3\\ 2 & 1 & 5\end{pmatrix}$$

So, we have:

$$a = 2, b = 3, c = 4, d = 1, e = 0, f = 3, g = 2, h = 1, i = 5$$

Now, we can plug these values into the formula:

$$\det(A) = 2(0\cdot5 - 3\cdot1) - 3(1\cdot5 - 3\cdot2) + 4(1\cdot1 - 0\cdot2)$$

$$\det(A) = 2(-3) - 3(-1) + 4(1)$$

$$\det(A) = -6 + 3 + 4$$

$$\det(A) = 1$$

So, the determinant of the given 3x3 matrix is 1.
